metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42323 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description: Xenstore: Cooperating guests can create arbitrary numbers of nodes T[hisCNA information record relates to multiple CVEs; the text explains whichaspects/vulnerabilities correspond to which CVE.] Since the fix of XSA-322any Xenstore node owned by a removed domain will be modified to be owned byDom0. This will allow two malicious guests working together to create anarbitrary number of Xenstore nodes. This is possible by domain A lettingdomain B write into domain A's local Xenstore tree. Domain B can thencreate many nodes and reboot. The nodes created by domain B will now beowned by Dom0. By repeating this process over and over again an arbitrarynumber of nodes can be created, as Dom0's number of nodes isn't limited byXenstore quota.

criterions.comment: xen package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
